original: Engblom, Alexander (Alex.) Natanael, civilingenjör, direktör, Borås, f. 17/2/85 i Södertälje av Eric E. o. Jo’se-fina Wilhelmina Helén. G. 1. 19 m. Solhems sjukh. i Borås, ordf. i Älvsb. 1. västgötadels lokalfören. av Scoutfrämj. arb :utsk., v. ordf. i De sju häradenas kulturhist. fören. o. ordf. i dess arb:-utsk., stift, av o. ordf. i Franska kl. i Borås, hed :kd. i All. Frangaise, ordf. i Decemberklubben i Borås, led. av styr. f. Sv.-franska ’Stift., ’Sakk. v. utformn. av den textiltekn. und:-visn. i Borås, led. av styr. f. Borås tekn. gymn. o. Tekn. mus., arb :ledareinst. o. Mell.’ o. N. translated: Engblom, Alexander (Alex.) Nathanael, engineer, director, Borås, born on February 17th, 1885 in Södertälje to Eric E. and Jose-fina Wilhelmina Helén. First marriage in 1919 to Elin Kerstin Ragnhild Ho’lmer, who passed away in 1938; second marriage in 1947 to Kerstin Evers. Children: Elsa Thyra Birgitta born in 1920, married to senior physician Lars-Erik Floberg in Stockholm, and Eric Arvid born in 1921. Studied at John Lennings vävskola in 1906 and KTH (mechanical department) from 1906-1908, obtaining his technical degree. He was a technical manager at Sidney Blumenthal & Co., Textile Mills in Shelten, Conn., USA from 1910-1917, chief engineer of Litograf. A-B in Norrköping from 1917-1920, and technical manager and chief engineer at Borås Wäfveri A-B in Borås from 1920 to 1947 when he became director. He was a board member of this company since 1926 and board member of Borås drätselkammare from 1925-1928, as well as several other committee positions. Engblom was chairman of Solhem foundation and Solhems sjukh. in Borås, chairman of the Älvsborg division of the Scout movement’s promotion committee, vice chairman of the De sju häradenas kulturhist. foren., and chairman of its work committee. He was also chairman of the Franska klubben in Borås, and an honorary member of Alliance Francaise. Other positions he held include chairman of the Decemberklubben in Borås, member of the board for Sv.-franska Stift., an expert for 40 years in the field of higher technical education and an assessor regarding the organization of textile and garment research. Engblom was a member of the board for the Swedish textile research institute in Gothenburg as well as its work committee, a board member of the Technical museum, and a leader in the institute and North Sweden Steamship Company, and textile industry federation. In Borås, he was chairman of Borås stads yrkesskola, Borås mönsterateljé, and member of the industrial fire protection committee in Älvsborg 1st division. Engblom was vice chairman of Swedish national commission for rational organization, and chairman of the Technical association in Borås from 1925-1940, thereafter becoming an honorary chairman. He was head of the second and third defense loans in Borås and became a member of IVA in 1932. He was chairman of the committee for IVA from 1932-1941 and IVA committee for air treatment. Engblom was also a fellow of the Textile Institute in Manchester in 1934, a fellow of American Society of Mechanical Engineers in 1938 and a member of Verein Deutscher Ingenieure. He wrote "Industriell organisation enl. den rationella arb:ledn. principer" (Industrial organization according to rational labour management principles) in 1922, as well as numerous articles, papers, and brochures on technical, organizational, social, and economic issues. Engblom held several honors including RNO, RVO, RFrHL, and 5 GM. His pseudonym was A-x E-m.
